alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 03 at 10:19PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Indiana, including the following county, Jefferson. * WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1018 PM EDT, emergency management reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 3 and 7 inches of rain have fallen in and near the warned area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Madison, China, Canaan, Manville, Belleview, Bryantsburg, Barbersville, Ringwald and North Madison. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
